verb.description: Say again something one has already said.
examples: the landlady repeated that she was being very lenient with him

verb.description: Do (something) again, either once or a number of times.
examples: earlier experiments were to be repeated on a far larger scale

verb.description: (of food) be tasted intermittently for some time after being swallowed as a result of belching or indigestion.
examples: it sat rather uncomfortably on my stomach and repeated on me for hours

noun.description: An action, event, or other thing that occurs or is done again.
examples: the final will be a repeat of last year

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French repeter, from Latin repetere, from re- back + petere seek.
